etymologies: late Middle English: from Old French regestre or medieval Latin regestrum, registrum, alteration of regestum, singular of late Latin regesta ‘things recorded’, from regerere ‘enter, record’

definitions: an official list or record, for example of births, marriages, and deaths, of shipping, or of historic places

examples.text: a membership register

shortDefinitions: official list or record of names or items

definitions: a book or record of attendance, for example of students in a class or school or guests in a hotel

examples.text: the system requires teachers to take the register at each lesson
I had signed the register with my new name

shortDefinitions: book or record of attendance

definitions: a particular part of the range of a voice or instrument

examples.text: his voice moved up a register
she plays a basset horn and relishes the duskiness of its lower register

shortDefinitions: particular part of range of voice or instrument

definitions: a sliding device controlling a set of organ pipes which share a tonal quality.
shortDefinitions: sliding device controlling set of organ pipes which share tonal quality

definitions: a set of organ pipes so controlled.
shortDefinitions: set of organ pipes controlled by sliding device

definitions: a variety of a language or a level of usage, as determined by degree of formality and choice of vocabulary, pronunciation, and syntax, according to the communicative purpose, social context, and social status of the user.
shortDefinitions: variety of language or level of usage, as determined by degree of formality and choice of vocabulary

definitions: the exact correspondence of the position of color components in a printed positive

examples.text: it was reproduced in full color but unfortunately out of register

shortDefinitions: exact correspondence of position of colour components in printed positive

definitions: the exact correspondence of the position of printed matter on the two sides of a page.
shortDefinitions: exact correspondence of position of printed matter on two sides of leaf

definitions: (in electronic devices) a location in a store of data, used for a specific purpose and with quick access time.
shortDefinitions: (in electronic devices) location in store of data, used for specific purpose

definitions: an adjustable plate for widening or narrowing an opening and regulating a draft, especially in a fire grate.
shortDefinitions: adjustable plate for widening or narrowing opening and regulating draught

definitions: one of a number of bands or sections into which a design is divided

examples.text: the central register shows a Roman Emperor on horseback

shortDefinitions: one of several bands or sections into which design is divided

definitions: enter or record on an official list or directory

examples.text: the vessel is registered as Liberian
her father was late in registering her birth

shortDefinitions: enter or record on official list or directory

definitions: enter one's name and other details on an official list or directory

examples.text: 34,500 registered to vote

shortDefinitions: enter one's name and other details on official list or directory

definitions: put one's name in a register as a guest in a hotel

examples.text: we had a light supper after we'd registered and unpacked

shortDefinitions: put one's name in register as guest in hotel

definitions: (of a couple to be married) have a list of wedding gifts compiled and kept at a store for consultation by gift buyers

examples.text: at the store's bridal registry single people can register for gifts even if they are not getting married

shortDefinitions: (of couple to be married) have list of wedding gifts compiled and kept at shop for consultation by gift buyers

definitions: entrust (a letter or parcel) to a post office for transmission by registered mail

examples.text: it is highly recommended that you register the letter containing your supporting documents

shortDefinitions: entrust letter or parcel to post office for transmission by registered post

definitions: (of an instrument) detect and show (a reading) automatically

examples.text: the electroscope was too insensitive to register the tiny changes

shortDefinitions: detect and show reading automatically

definitions: (of an event) give rise to a specified reading on an instrument

examples.text: the blast registered 5.4 on the Richter scale

shortDefinitions: give rise to specified reading on instrument

definitions: express or convey (an opinion or emotion)

examples.text: I wish to register an objection
he did not register much surprise at this.

shortDefinitions: express or convey

definitions: (of an emotion) show in a person's face or gestures

examples.text: nothing registered on their faces

shortDefinitions: show in person's face or gestures

definitions: properly notice or become aware of (something)

examples.text: he had not even registered her presence

shortDefinitions: notice or become aware of

synonyms.text: be aware of the fact that
become aware of the fact that
be conscious of the fact that
become conscious of the fact that

definitions: make an impression on a person's mind

examples.text: the content of her statement did not register

shortDefinitions: make impression on person's mind

definitions: correspond or cause to correspond exactly in position

examples.text: they are adjusted until the impressions register

shortDefinitions: correspond or cause to correspond exactly in position
